Los Angeles, California.

The day I left you I just drove and drove.  I drove all day and all that night, and I didn't go anywhere.  I just kept driving.  I stopped at a little country church, and the pastor let me in, and I sat--
Betty Sizemore.  What do you mean you wrote it?
Well, David moved out here and started his residency.  Then he met Leslie--
I married a car salesman.
Why are you calling him George?
No, Del.
You knew Del?!
I'm so sorry.  Life makes us do awful things sometimes.
There was no plan!  I was just young and stupid and scared!
I know that.  I can't tell you how many times I've said that to myself in those exact words.
Why do they keep calling you George?
Oh my God!  What's Lonnie doing here?
You bastard!  How can you even show your face around here?  Do you think we're not onto you?
I know exactly who you are!
Lyla's very nice.
She told me I was charming and relentless, and would go far in this town.  And she said that unlike the other charming, relentless people she knew, she liked me.
You told me that two hours ago.
I haven't been this happy since I was twelve years old.

For Mother's Day, I used all my allowance that I'd been saving to take my mother to Kansas City.  We got our nails done and had lunch at "Skies," a restaurant at the top of a building from where you can see the whole city.  It was the last outing we took together.  She died the following year.
I just want everything to be perfect between us.
Of course.
I know. It's up to us.
I love you, David.  And I want to see you tomorrow, and the next day, and the next day.
He is real.
To a party in the Hollywood Hills.
Yes.  I'd never been in a place like that before.
No, almost never.
Are you sure I can borrow this?
You should have a little faith in people.
All the time.  It's always "Loma Vista"
Rosa, so you've met David?
Oh, he does that.
It's this silly game he plays.  Half the people who know him call him George.
So where are we going?

I remember.  You said it to her, but it was meant for me, wasn't it?

Ad lib?

It's people with no lives watching other people's fake lives.

I better go check on them.

You should get the order you want.
They're just eggs, Elden, how embarrassing can eggs be?

Hey, Betty.  Are you okay?
Uh-huh.
Oww! My arm, careful!
She knows who killed Del.  Elden, she said it was a woman.
Yes it was.  Betty saw the whole thing!
So, you think you're gonna find his scalp hanging in some tepee?
Did you send anyone out there?
You better handle what's in this garbage can first.
Yeah?
Anyway, so what?
You said a woman couldn't have done it.
So you're saying Betty Sizemore - our Betty Sizemore--who you were in swing choir with--has now hired somebody to scalp her husband in her own kitchen while she watched?  You're amazing.
Oh, you're sharp as a tack, Elden.
Oww, the arm, the arm!
press, I have rights!!
What if the killers didn't see her?  You published her picture - you're gonna get her killed!
You're lying!

Tell him what you told me.

Yeah?  Well, she called Sue Ann yesterday from Arizona.
You gotta do that much.

I should have never come back here after college.

Elden, let me out of here. Now! This is ridiculous, I need medical attention!

Little place called "Williams," why?
I know plenty.
Betty!  Boy, am I glad to see you!

Hello there!  You've reached Sizemore Motors, home of the best selection of used General Motors cars in the Big Springs - Fair Oaks area. You got it.
If you ate at the Tip Top you did.

Are you kidding me?  What's to like?

This is bullshit, can we get down to business here, please?
Jesus Christ!
The Indians, Injuns, whatever.  They're always drunk and doing stupid things.
My socks?

PLEASE DON'T KILL ME!!!
What the hell are you doing here?
Well, are you gonna answer me?  What'd you come here for?

I gotta run.  Got some serious clients to meet, with real potential.
Goddamn, it's hot!
Need something else?
How's things at the Tip Top?
You must be joking.
Uh-huh.
Anyway, I'm thinking Easter, 'cause I just fucking love pastels.

What did you say?
Know him?  We were gonna get married! He was gonna leave his wife for me!
Oh, Betty--
Honey, I'm really sorry, I was gonna call you about tonight. Larry's got a lodge meeting. There's no way I can get a sitter this fast.
I can't ask her again-- Nathan, stop it!
So what color is it?
The LeSabre!
What?
Oh, I wish we could just get in it and drive, and drive, and drive!
Happy Birthday to you!  Happy Birthday to you!  Happy Birthday, dear--
Let me know if you need anything, okay?
Well, you are.
Yeah, hon.  Real bad.  You just get some sleep, everything's gonna be fine.
I wish I could help you, but I can't.
No.
No.  But I'm taping her show every day so she can watch it when she comes back.
"A Reason to Love."
I don't think she will. She's a slut, but I just don't think she's that mean.
Halfway where? You've gotta come home.
Betty, honey, listen to me.  A man came by from Mutual Life Insurance.  He says you've got money comin' to you from Del's policy.
Del's life insurance policy-- Are you with me?
Do what?
Is this Neighborly Life Insurance?
What's with the tupperware, Elden, did Meredith run outta baggies?
Come on, Elden, she's not on the run.
Mr. Campbell?
Is this Neighborly Life Insurance?
It's Sue Ann Rogers, Betty Sizemore's friend?  I heard from her.
That's my best friend!
Bourbon, little water, thank you.
Your wife's a very lovely woman.  Have I seen her before?
Who's birthday?
If we're for real?
We appreciate that.  But you just poured me a drink, I'd like to enjoy your hospitality for a few minutes.
It's a nice place you got here.  Real comfortable.  Sweet little town, Fair Oaks.  You like it here?
What do you mean?
Could you give us an example?
I'm asking you for an example of one of these dumb fucks being a dumb fuck.
You're not a dumb fuck, are you, Del?
I didn't think so.  So, give me an example of a stupid person doing a stupid thing.  Not being stupid, you're equipped to recognize it.
I'm just curious.  Can't you give me an example?
Hmmmm.  "Five Stars," huh?
Is that stupid, Wesley?
That's what I thought.
You better give me another example.
You did not just say "Injuns," Del.
Like what?
Well, my idea of stupid is very different from yours.
So here's how this is gonna work.  Would you take your socks off, please?
Now I'm gonna tell you what stupid is.
Stupid is trying to sell it to other people who are, by their very nature, untrustworthy.
Stupid is calling people in Kansas City who are affiliated with the rightful owners of the thing you stole, and trying to sell it to them.  Right Wesley?
So you see, we have totally different ideas of what's stupid and what's not.
Good.  Now we're getting somewhere.  You agree that you were stupid?
You know, a hundred and fifty years ago you'd have been scalped for that remark about Native Americans.  Right here where your house is - you'd have been scalped.
It wasn't always fatal, Wesley.  We could scalp Del right now, and he'd be plenty alive to tell us how it feels.
It's pretty simple, too.
Then you grab a big handful of hair and pull as you cut.  It's amazing how easily the scalp comes off.
Now.  I want to know the particulars of your stupid act:  how you got what doesn't belong to you, who helped you get it, and of course, where it is now.
Consider yourself lucky.  Luckier than those 'Injuns' you have such contempt for.
I'll tell you, if anyone got a raw deal it's the American Indian.  This country has a black mark on its soul for what was done to them.
I'm all for them owning casinos, getting rich off the white man's greed.  It's a beautiful piece of irony, isn't it, Wesley?
JESUS CHRIST!!!
What the fuck is the matter with you?!
Are you out of your mind?  You scalped him!
That was to get him to talk!
Get rid of that thing, will you?
This is great - just great!  Now we don't know where the goddamn stuff is.
We don't know which Buick, do we?
I had to shoot him!  It was the only decent thing to do.
I saw his soul Wesley.  He was face to face with his God, and no one lies in that situation.  But your Geronimo act rattled me, and I abandoned my instincts.
Never abandon you instincts.
What 'look'?
I wasn't done, I was just sick of hearing him whine.  And you didn't take him out, you scalped him.  Christ, I almost puked, did I tell you that?
What the hell does that mean?  If I'd told a Ty Cobb story would you have clubbed him to death with a bat?
It's not here.  Let's go.

Let me tell you something.  In our business you can't put food on the table if your phone doesn't ring.  The guys who get the calls are good - not flashy, just good.  They get in, they get out.  Nobody knows a goddamn thing.  Understand?
Fine, I'll get you a bumpersticker, but you better start believing it!  It's the only statement you need to make.
Mmmm.  Well, it was a piece of luck running into you, Duane. I thought I was  42.
What part of Dixie are you from, Duane?
I'm a Yankee, myself.  Massachusetts.
You know, it's interesting.  The South lost the Civil War, but they still seem to get all the glory.
Jeb Stuart, Stonewall Jackson, Jefferson Davis - they're all losers in my book.
Even Robert E. Lee was a loser.
Did you know the most brutal, inhumane prison of the entire war was in Georgia?
Andersonville.
Del's dead, by the way.  I sent him to the Great Beyond.
Exactly.
Now, the one thing I don't get is that we checked all the Buicks on that lot.  Four '97 LeSabres and nothing in 'em.
So, what happened to the fifth car?
You know you're going to die, don't you, Duane?
And you really don't know where that other LeSabre is, do you?
He's telling the truth.  He doesn't know.
Wait.  Any last words, General Lee?
God, I admire that.  Ya see that, Wesley?
Come on, Wesley, three shots.
What the hell was that, another statement?
He said he gave his wife some car as a gift, remember?
This is bad, Wesley.  Very, very bad.
Did you hear what I said?
Maybe you don't appreciate the gravity of this situation.  It's bad enough that we don't have what we came here for.  It's worse that we don't know where it is. And now this.
This was supposed to be my last job.  I already put the deposit down on my boat.
But she wanted more out of life, right?
I see.
May I?
Thank you for your cooperation.
So she gets rid of the asshole and is set for life in the same day.
Joyce was screwing Del.
I'd say that about torches her credibility, wouldn't you?
Yes?
Sorry, you've got the wrong number.
No, I see Betty as a Midwestern Stoic type.  Ice water in her veins.  A clear thinker.  Probably a Swede or a Finn.

You should read more.  Listen to me.  I think this woman was waiting for a chance to do this, and we gave it to her.  She kept to herself for years, living with a pompous asshole.  Then she sees her opportunity, and BOOM! - she leaves that little mudpatch in the dust.  These heartlanders can't figure it out, 'cause that's not their sweet little Betty.
Oh, for Chrissakes.  It just means the kind of person who can eat shit for a long time without complaining, then cut their momma's throat and go dancing the same night.
Very graceful.  Perfect form.
Wise beyond her years, I'm sure, and such poise, too.
What do you mean?
Mrs. Blaine?  I can tell you right now, without a doubt, that your granddaughter is alive, and did not kill Del Sizemore.
My partner's still young, Mr. Blaine, and he loves his job.
He'd like to kill all the criminals himself!
Now, if Betty was running from someone, where do you think she'd go?

"I wish that I could find a way; To speak my thoughts on Mother's Day.  There are no words that quite express; My gratitude or happiness.  A pleasant smile perhaps a kiss; I would not fail to give her this.

AND TURN THAT FUCKING MUSIC OFF!

Do I deserve this?  In the twilight of my career, do I deserve this?  I don't think so!  I've always tried to do what's right.  I never took out anybody who didn't have it coming.  I'm a professional!
AND WHERE THE FUCK AM I?  I'M IN PURGATORY!

GET IN THE CAR!
What're you thinking, girl?  What's going on in that pretty little mind of yours?
See, in a LeSabre Betty's probably getting twenty-two, maybe twenty-five miles to the gallon, where we're topping out at fifteen.
She's probably all cool and fresh, and comfortable in that nice air-conditioned car right now.
You don't look comfortable here.  That's 'cause you don't like being the center of attention, do you?  Nah. You're like me.
That was a really shitty thing to do.
Don't talk like that.  She's my last one, Wesley, my final target.
Don't you realize your special, that you represent something?
How'd they describe her?
We should go.
It's a very moving experience, trust me.
One of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World.
What difference does it make?  She wasn't in Kansas City, or Houston, or Dallas. We  92.
Does that sound like a goddamn showgirl to you?

If you don't take the next turn for the canyon, I'm blowing my goddamn brains all over this car.
You don't know what you're missing, asshole.
Where?  Where is she?
What?
This doesn't look like the kind of place Betty would go to.
Be careful with that!
We're looking for this young lady.
You haven't been very forthcoming with us.
What's your name, dear?
That's a nice name.
So you believed the bartender.  Why?
That's good.  You're learning.  But let me tell you why I know she was lying.
First off, Betty would never fall for a soap star.  It's beneath her.

Don't  Don't you talk about Betty like that.  I don't care who she ends up being, you never use that word again.

I was wrong.
Now, get yourself ready.
Thanks so much.  You must get bothered by this kind of thing a lot.
No, that should be more than--
Well, you were right about what that bartender said.
What do your instincts tell you to do now, kid?
We could do that.  I could be on my way to Florida, and you could go to Thailand and fuck your brains out.
No, I said to follow 'my' instincts.
I'm Detective Jefferson--
We'll do what we can.  Where is she?
We meet again.
I've spent many long hours in a car with your face staring back at me.  I've seen it painted on the horizon.
Get rid of them.  You understand?
Two thousand miles?  That's nothing!

Who are these idiots?
Do you know who I am?
Do you know why I'm here?
So you weren't involved with him in his pathetic attempt to diversify?
